cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.SI

This paper is likely to belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category as it proposes a new method for selecting the Gaussian kernel bandwidth for the SVDD classifier, which is a popular technique for anomaly detection in machine learning. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of unsupervised learning, which is a common topic in the machine learning sub-category. 

The paper also mentions the use of kernel functions, which are commonly used in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and computer vision (cs.CV) sub-categories. 

Furthermore, the paper discusses the issue of overfitting and underfitting, which are common topics in the neural networks (cs.NE) sub-category. 

Finally, the paper proposes a new method for selecting the Gaussian kernel bandwidth, which involves computing the mean and median criteria. This method falls under the statistical learning (cs.SI) sub-category, which deals with the use of statistical methods in machine learning.
